title: Simple WSGI composition: story of one refactoring (#51)
description:
Simple WSGI composition: story of one refactoring

Presented by Max Ischenko

Story of a refactoring I did to split one big, monolithic Pylons app
into a bunch of smaller ones, using power of WSGI and nginx. The devil
is in the details: how to handle common auth, site-wide look and feel,
common utilities, database management. Pros and cons of the approach,
possible alternatives.

The talk assumes listeners know what WSGI is and preferably have used
some WSGI-centered framework like Pylons, Werkzeug, Paste or other.

The application this talk describes powers developers.org.ua.
